subhead: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu has proposed a temporary halt to a contested 2023 pension reform that increased the legal retirement age to 64. Yet is the suspension even guaranteed to go ahead?

Digital detox centers are tackling South Korea's growing tech addiction
subhead: Seoul has made advanced technology a pillar of its economic development, but the nation's youth are consequently facing high exposure to digital addiction. The issue is so acute that the government funds programs to treat dependency on smartphones and online gaming.

headline: Ace Frehley, founding member and original guitarist of Kiss, dies at 74
subhead: Frehley was a founding member of the glam rock band, alongside singer-guitarist Paul Stanley, bassist Gene Simmons and drummer Peter Criss.

headline: 'The Diplomat' season 3: Kate Wyler heads to Washington
subhead: With the help of two former collaborators from 'The West Wing,' Debora Cahn's series shifts its focus to American – and romantic – stakes.

headline: France's last military pigeons, custodians of a fading tradition
subhead: The Mont Valérien fortress west of Paris houses the last military dovecote in Europe. In an era of ultra-technological weaponry, the carrier pigeon now flies only for official ceremonies, but remains a powerful symbol of the army's history.

subhead: When the FBI presented 'Group 78' to European counterparts in November 2024, some officials were shocked. They expressed particular concerns about the integrity of their investigations.

headline: Taxing the super-rich? The 'Zucman tax' explained
subhead: A proposal to tax the super-rich by a French economist called Gabriel Zucman has taken center stage in debates about France's budget as Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu tries to stifle another governmental crisis.
